info.name: Duffel API Quick Start Collection
info.description:
A walkthrough on how to go from nothing to your first booking using the Duffel API.

In order to follow this guide, you'll need to:

- [Sign up](https://app.duffel.com/join) for a Duffel Account (it takes about 1 minute!)
- Create a test token from the "Access Tokens" page in your [Dashboard](https://app.duffel.com) and paste it in the `Authorization` section of the Postman Collection (**Don't forget to hit save afterwards**)

Our requests have a pre-defined sequence to replicate creating a booking in a real world scenario:
1. Searching for Flights
2. Selecting an offer from the previous Search
3. Creating a booking from the selected offer

**NOTE:** By running the requests in the sequence mentioned above, you'll get most fields automatically pre-filled for you.

exec: pm.test("Contains a list of offers", function () {

request.description:
In the Duffel API you create an offer request in order to search for flights.

For this you'll need the flight itinerary - which should include the origin(s), destination(s) and departure date(s) - and information about the passengers.

response.name: Searching for Flights

item.name: Selecting an offer from the search results

request.description:
Offers can get stale fairly quickly, and when they do you are no longer able to book them.

To get the latest version of the offer, you can use the offer's `id` using this endpoint

item.name: Creating a booking using the selected offer

request.description:
We are finally ready to make a booking using the Duffel API which we call "creating an order".

For this you'll need three things:
1. The ID of the offer you'd like to book (taken from the previous request you did)
2. Basic necessary information about the passengers
3. Payment method and information to confirm the order

request.description:
In the Duffel API you create an offer request in order to search for flights.

For this you'll need the flight itinerary - which should include the origin(s), destination(s) and departure date(s) - and information about the passengers.

item.name: Creating a booking using the selected offer(single passenger)

request.description:
We are finally ready to make a booking using the Duffel API which we call "creating an order".

For this you'll need three things:
1. The ID of the offer you'd like to book (taken from the previous request you did)
2. Basic necessary information about the passengers
3. Payment method and information to confirm the order
